qas.question: What did the nuns not do in the Dominican Order?
What was one of the activities the nuns enjoyed?
Who was expelled from a nunnery for not wanting to learn?
What monastery did the nuns belong to who could speak Latin fluently?
What did the nuns of the Dominican order do among people?

plausible_answers.text: the need to engage in study

qas.question: What was immediate or intense for the nuns as it was for men?

plausible_answers.text: sewing and embroidery, nuns often engaged in reading and discussing correspondence from Church leaders

qas.question: What activities did the nuns not have to do?
What Strasbourg monastery did some nuns not converse fluently in Latin?

context: Because the nuns of the order did not <a0_0><b5_0>preach<b5_0/> among the people<a0_0/>, <b6_0>the need to engage in study<b6_0/> was not as immediate or intense as it was for men. They did participate, however, in a number of intellectual activities. Along with <b7_0>sewing and <a1_0>embroidery<a1_0/>, nuns often engaged in reading and discussing correspondence from Church leaders<b7_0/>. In the <a4_0>Strassburg monastery of <b8_0>St. Margaret<b8_0/><a4_0/>, some of the nuns could converse fluently in Latin. Learning still had an elevated place in the lives of these religious. In fact, <a2_0>Margarette Reglerin<a2_0/>, a daughter of a wealthy <a3_0>Nuremberg<a3_0/> family, was dismissed from a convent because she did not have the ability or will to learn.
